In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution to your problem using Julia programming language:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df.dt)
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` as an argument and adds a new column `ym` to it. The values in this new column are calculated by mapping over the `dt` column of the DataFrame, extracting the year and month from each DateTime value, concatenating them together into an integer format "yyyymm", and adding this to the DataFrame.

You can use this function like so:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=DateTime[now()-Month(i) for i in 1:3], x=[1,2,3])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will create a new column `ym` with the year and month of each DateTime value from the `dt` column.
